page.title: 04RELIGION IN CHITTERNE
page.content: {Church of England.}All that remains of St. Mary's Church is its Chancel. A Holy Communion Service is held at nine o'clock on the third Sunday of each month from April to October. Winter Services are not held as there is no heating. Up to 30th June, 1985, the Rev. R. F. Dossetor, M.A., Priest-in- Charge of Tilshead, Orcheston and Chitterne officiated at the Services. Since his retirement there has been an interregnum and Services have been taken by visiting, usually retired, clergy. The congregation ranges from eight or nine to about twenty five. The Chancel begins to feel crowded when more than twenty five people are present! {Baptists.}The Chapel remains, but has been closed for worship for many years. Monthly informal services are held in the village hall.
